programmes.show_description: The Garnetts' game of Monopoly is disrupted by a blackout. S5 E3: Strikes and Blackouts
With David Bowie and Rachel Sweet. The legendary BAFTA-winning music and comedy show from Thames TV (1979). All in the best possible taste!
Simon tries to help to rebalance the odds when a woman takes advantage of her pharmacist husband and tries to build her own cosmetic empire to leave the husband with nothing. S2 E21: Good Medicine
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
When Travis has serious school news that he's scared to break to his mum, Sharon decides she'll pass herself off as Tracey and sort out his problems. S12 E7: Blonde on Blonde
With Sally away tanning in the Costa del Sol, Thomas and Pippa also find themselves on foreign soil on the trail of Lively, who has suddenly disappeared back to Ireland. S3 E5: The Sisters of Achill
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!

Operation Smile provide world-class cleft care in more than 30 countries helped by thousands of highly skilled medical volunteers. TELESHOPPING.
Your favourite music from the 1960s - non-stop.
Your favourite music from the 1960s - non-stop.
Examining the history of war tactics. Breaking a fortified line is the battleplan every soldier fears. It means attacking defences head-on and it's going to be a bloodbath. S2 E1
Having long been allies, the US suddenly invaded Panama in 1989 with the rescue of an American hostage and the hunt for Panama's dictator. S2 E1: The Invasion of Panama

The B-25, often called 'the forgotten bomber', the mighty North American twin delivered the first blow in the fight back against Japan, in one of the most daring and audacious raids of all time. S2 E3
The Waffen-SS were renowned for their brutality and tenacity, characteristics which made them the subject of numerous Allied war crime investigations. Ep1: Waffen-SS
A look at London's first 1,000 years includes treasures unearthed by Crossrail, the ruins of Roman Londinium, handwritten messages dating back 2,000 years and the first London Bridge. Ep1

Col. Tim Collins reinvestigates one of the most celebrated campaigns of WWII - the war in North Africa - looking at the Siege of Tobruk and the Battle of El Alamein. Ep1: Tobruk - Triumph and Disaster
It was Hitler's deadliest secret - his scientists had promised him an atomic bomb and Nazi domination was assured if he got it first.
Tank development was dramatic in World War II; we see the emergence of monster tanks from pre-war light tanks, but were the German tanks over-engineered and too vulnerable to breakdown? Ep1: Tanks
We explore the evolution of the main battle tank - charting its progress from the fields of WWI France to the deserts of Iraq - and check out its arch-rival of 'tank killer weapons'. E1: Heavy Metal
The story about the family of the man who embodies the darkest pages in history, this film puts an accent on his legacy as it stands today; who are the heirs of Hitler, and where do they live today?
With Dusty Springfield, Elvis Costello and The Police. The legendary BAFTA-winning comedy extravaganza from Thames TV (1980). All in the best possible taste!
Hit '70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, who are forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S6, E4: Workers' Playtime
April 1907: in an effort to try to make the servants' lives better, Lady Marjorie and other ladies with staff organise a day in the park so that they can socialise. S1 E8: I Dies From Love
Arthur hires failed safe-cracker Scotch Harry for a job - and finds himself with a bandaged fugitive on his hands. S6 E3: Return of the Invincible Man
Dempsey is stalked by a psychopathic admirer who hates Makepeace for being with him and has a deadly way of showing her affection. S2 E3: Love You to Death
Drama series following the exploits of Life on Mars DCI Gene Hunt. Hunt and his faithful sidekicks are drawn to the London Met where he turns his attentions to taking on London's criminals. S1 E3
Else decides to take the government's advice and begins her own campaign to save energy. S5 E4: Three Day Week
With The Moody Blues and David Essex. The legendary BAFTA-winning music and comedy show from Thames TV (1979). All in the best possible taste!
A successful businessman begins to divest his assets and interests following a dreadful car accident; is foul play afoot, and can Simon spot what is happening? S2 E22: The Invisible Millionaire
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Sharon and Tracey work out that Dorien has an important birthday coming up - and decide that the event calls for a celebration whatever she thinks. S12 E8: Forever Young
Thomas gets to meet Sally's uncle Leonard, who is a showbiz agent; when Leonard dies of a heart attack not long after, Sally is left to sort things out. S3 E6: A Roman Empire

Examining the history of war tactics. A raid is an offensive military operation that aims to achieve a specific objective. It is a battleplan which often requires elite special forces. S2 E2
The best-kept secrets of the air campaign in the Gulf War are uncovered, from classified spy plane missions to strategic plans to destroy Iraqi targets. S2 E2: The Gulf War - Steel Rain
The many variants of the A-1 Skyraider single piston-engined fighter bomber helped dominate the air to ground attack role in Vietnam and earned quite the reputation. S2 E4
Colonel Tim Collins investigates the brilliant Axis intelligence coup which helped Erwin Rommel's Afrika Korps sweep forward to threaten Cairo. Ep2: Victory and Controversy at El Alamein
The Special Operations Executive nurtured and supported Resistance movements across occupied Europe, the Middle East and the Far East while their lives were constantly under threat. Ep2: S.O.E
Exploring medieval London, what Westminster Abbey reveals about the competition between the crown and the city, the cellars below the Ministry of Defence and artefacts owned by Henry VIII. Ep2
The Resistance asked for help in late 1943 as some of their top operatives were being held in Amiens prison and needed rescuing from facing interrogation, torture and execution. Ep2: Prison Busters
From attacks on Pearl Harbor to the British Mediterranean Fleet and the Tirpitz, midget submarines played their part in some of the most gripping stories of the war. Ep2: Midget Submarines
The helicopter gunship's future looked in doubt in the first Gulf War of 1991 - now their biggest threat in the 21st century isn't any sort of enemy, but rather cost. E2: Hellfire and Brimstone
We look at three different German U-boat wrecks from WWII including UC-66 - the first to be sunk by a plane - and U-480, the world's first stealth sub. Ep1: Assassins of the Deep
With David Essex and Ellen Foley. The legendary BAFTA-winning comedy extravaganza from Thames TV (1980). All in the best possible taste!
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S6, E5: The Right Spirit
November 1907: the loss of Emily has affected the staff a great deal, but Mrs Bridges appears to be so upset that she can no longer contain her emotions. S1 E9: Why Is Her Door Locked?
Faced with a huge tax bill, Arthur fakes his own death and hides - but Chisholm is suspicious. S6 E4: Arthur is Dead, Long Live Arthur
When a top international banker is held to ransom, Makepeace offers herself as a hostage. S2 E4: No Surrender
Drama series following the exploits of Life on Mars's DCI Gene Hunt. Alex smells a conspiracy when the body of a worker at a nuclear research centre disappears from the morgue. S1 E4
